name: Holiday Inn Mexico Zocalo

reviews.text: I recently stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, I choose it primarily for its location as it is very central and as a single woman traveller I wanted to avoid public transport and visit the town centre by foot as much as possible. I had initial concerns about noise, especially once I saw that my room window faced a fairly congested road however I felt better once I saw the windows were double-glazed and the rooms have thick curtains. I had sound sleep all 3 nights though no sleeping till late morning, by 8 -9 am you hear car honks and traffic. If you plan on sleeping till late I would not recommend a room which faces the street. I found that the computers in the lobby are really good for internet and e-mails however it is shame they only have 2 and at times you need to wait for your turn, they could do with adding another 2 or 3 computers for guests. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and pleasant, the only area I was not too impressed with was breakfast, they could do better and offer a better presentation & selection of fruit. I recommend this hotel if it is for a few days and your priority is location and cleanliness.
reviews.title: Good central location & clean

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip while filming a commercial for my client.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was fantastic, being a single female traveler I was a little concerned but I felt safe walking around Zocalo alone. Cute street vendors, book markets, and live shows speckle the large Square. I had no issues with the drummers in the Square but I did not stay over a weekend. I would say this is probably the safest area in Mexico City to stay if it is your first time visiting.
reviews.title: Almost Great

likes.disliked: — Only 1 chair, no table, no luggage stands, 1 desk that doubles as TV table

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree the rooftop view is awesome and that the staff is very friendly. My room was tiny but extremely clean and well kept. Room service was nice and prompt, beautiful presentation as well.
reviews.title: Great Location and Friendly Service
Great Historic Dist Location Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel arranged for a cab driver to take me to the pyramids, saving me from the "drivers" that station themselves outside the hotel trying to get tourists as a fare.

reviews.title: A Good Place
reviews.text: Overall a great place to stay and would stay there again if the opportunity arises.
Stayed here for a week during 28Aor08 to 3May08.
reviews.title: Superb location & great value

likes.liked: — Location, Value, Proximity to restaurants & sightseeing
likes.disliked: — Some noise due to location being on the Zocalo (cathedral square)

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is very good value. The location is unbeatable as you can walk to everywhere within 10 mins.
reviews.title: On the Zocalo, but quiet!

reviews.text: During my stay the lobby bar was being renovated and the restaurant bar had no atmosphere. The food is okay, not excellent but just average. Service is below average. That said, there's no need to stay in the hotel for meals as there are some excellent restaurants in the vicinity. I highly recommend the famous Cafe Tacuba as well as the excellent El Vegetariano on Filomeno Mata (about 5 mins walk).
reviews.title: Watch the price you are quoted

reviews.text: Within a short walk are the old temples (Templo Mayor) as well as several old cathedrals. The old city has wonderful architecture and great boutique restaurants.
reviews.title: Awesome Location!

likes.disliked: — Restaurants in the hotel as well as around the area leaves a bit to be desired

reviews.text: If you crave the nightlife, Polanco has a lot to offer and is only 12-15 mins by taxi.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I are not bar hoppers, so we didn't staty out after 7 p.m. at night. But we never felt threatened on any of the streets around the zocalo/almeda. Took the normal precautions.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Would return in a heartbeat. Just sad that they don't offer two double beds or suites.
reviews.title: Best deal in Mexico city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Holiday Inn-Zocalo last week was perfect. The more I became familiar with the rest of the city, the more I appreciated our choice. As a photographer, I found the streets surrounding the hotel vibrant, authentic and surprisingly safe. The staff and service was excellent. The rooms are small, the bed is hard, yet it didn't really matter when a few steps out the door you were in the middle of where Mexica culture started and continues today. It really felt like home and was an incredible value, IMO.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

likes.disliked: — The hurdy-gurdy man/woman playing across the street was very annoying.

reviews.title: BE CAREFUL - Lovely hotel, but we had our camera stolen
reviews.text: Great hotel to stay in, right next to the Zocalo. Everything was very nice, I stayed here twice and the service was constant both times. The price is expensive if you are travelling on a student budget (as I was) but can be worth it if you are staying only for a couple of days.

I was here for a one week conference and was assigned this hotel. It is a Holiday Inn. The beds are uncomfortable, the linens are poor, and the pillows tolerable. The comforter slides off the bed while you sleep. The rooms are noisy, since you are next to Zocola square. The staff is OK but just do there job and do not go out of their way to help you. For instance, my room was not cleaned well; i was to receive a fed-ex package and they were no help in locating it (I had to call fed-ex), my laundry showed up at my hotel room at 10:30 PM when I had the privacy on. The only merit is the location to Temple Mayor, shopping, and restaurants (there is a McDonalds and 7-Eleven next door). The restaurant at the hotel for breakfast was fine. It has a great view of the square and service was good. I would stay elsewhere like the Sheraton Historico or Four Seasons next time.
reviews.title: What a dump
At home in Holiday Inn Zocalo
reviews.text: If you're a history and culture buff, then Holiday Inn Zocalo in Mexico City will be a hit for you. Located at the corner of 5 de Mayo, one of the streets surrounding that great square called the Zocalo, you will be near the Metropolitan Cathedral, the National Government Building, the Mexico City Government Building, and some archeological finds like the Templo Mayor within walking distance.

We arrived at about 10 pm on a Thursday. When the reception clerk couldn't understand us, the English speaking Mr. Carlos Mata was called to help us. We were shown to our room with a double bed and 3 pillows. The bathroom has a good hot and cold shower which was easy to adjust to the right temperature. Bathroom amenities incuded 3 big towels, three hand towels, three small towels with 1 bath robe, plus the usual soap, shampoo and conditioner small bottles. Surprise! there was a small can of shoe polish, interesting, isn't it? The room was equipped with a personally controlled airconditioner (which was a big bonus since we can decide when we want it cold or warm inside the room).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast is more than sufficient with the buffet table laden with fruits, fruit juices, french toast, pancakes, Mexican breakfast staples. There was a corner to order eggs as you like it, sunny side up or scrambled, with a lovely senorita cooking on the spot for you. Endless coffee refills as you wanted. But the best part is the view of the whole Zocalo square ...where the 8:00 ritual of flag raising is done. You have to see it and feel the Mexican spriri of pride as a retinue of soldiers emerge from the National Government building, complete with a brass band, then raise the biggest flag I have seen at the middle of the square.
reviews.title: Perfect Historical Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff is another wonderful thing. If you're ever booked there, look for Mr. Daniel Aguilar at the Concierge's table. He speaks very good English and is a wealth of information on where to go, what to do, and is a big help on your travel needs. He was a big help to us when we were anxiously waiting for our tour guide, approaching us without our even asking and "taking charge" of the situation. Very friendly man, this Daniel.
reviews.title: Loved the view of the Zocalo

reviews.text: Staying at the Holiday Inn Zocalo is not the usual kind of bland, reliable and forgettable experience associated with most Holiday Inns elsewhere. The place has a particular character that makes it memorable, largely (though not entirely) for the right reasons.
reviews.title: A good, characterful hotel, though some might find noise offputting

likes.liked: — The location (close to all the main sites)
likes.disliked: — The location (close to the noisiest of sites)

reviews.text: The location is excellent, within effortless reach of all of the tourist sites in the Centrico Historico. By day, the liveliness of the surrounding streets makes casual meandering an enjoyable experience (and one that’s much less in-your-face than might be expected). By night, I wouldn’t say the area is at all threatening, but the crowds of tourists – and the even bigger crowds of people trying to sell things to tourists – tend to disappear after about 9pm.
reviews.title: perfect location
A Gem of a Hotel for Tourists
reviews.text: The hotel itself has a nice ambience, its communal areas lacking the usual sterility of the big chain hotels. It feels very much a Mexican undertaking – rather than an American one. The bar is small and pretty lifeless, but a perfectly decent meeting place before heading off to the rather more lively offerings elsewhere. The restaurant is on the top floor, with an outdoor terrace with agreeable views of the city. I only sampled breakfast, but the food on offer was good and the cost, although high by Mexican standards, was low in comparison to North America or Europe.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The rooms again are some way off the usual you-could-be-anywhere experience associated with Holiday Inns et al. Their stripped down simplicity was for me a plus point, though some might miss the availability of internet access or zillions of channels of unwatchable US television. The overall feel is not unlike a decent quality Mediterranean hotel. The only real downside is the endless daytime noise from the uniformed hurdy-gurdy player (and his monkey) perched on a daily basis outside the front of the hotel. If you plan to stay in your room for any length of time during the day, the barrel organ and its depressingly repetitive repertoire could well be a major irritant. Proximity to the Zocalo - the epicentre of protest for Mexico - can also create noise at by day or night (though that's offset by the incredible spectacle of watching these serial protesters at work).
All in all, though, the Holiday Inn Zocalo is a perfectly good place to stay, whether as a tourist or on business.
reviews.title: Good value, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were on the small, side but spotlessly clean and newly renovated. The closet was big enough to hold an opened suitcase.
reviews.title: Great location

aka: Holiday Inn Mexico City Zocalo Hotel Mexico City
description: Hotel Holiday Inn Zocalo is located in the Main Square of the Historical Center of Mexico City and is the only five star hotel of International prestige in this area.Located in front of the National Palace of Government,Monte de Piedad, and the Metropolitan Cathedral, the hotel is only five minutes from the Bellas Artes Palace, Aztec ruins of the Templo Mayor, San Idelfonso Museum, the Supreme Court of Justice, and is surrounded by museums, theatres, restaurants, stores, handcraft markets and financial centers. The hotel maintains all the importance and grandeur of its colonial building, where Emperor Moctezuma's Palace was located, and later, the residence of the conqueror Hernan Cortes. Today, from the terrace-restaurant to the comfortable suites with amazing views of the Zocalo, you will feel that ancestral glory that Holiday Inn Zocalo preserves with its beautiful interior and modern facilities. The warmest welcome proves why it is another treasure of the Historical Center and heritage of humanity. We are the only hotel with its own parking.For this season we handle many packages to discover the beautiful downtown area, like Turibus & Six Flags . The Holiday Inn Zocalo is the offical hotel of Bellas Artes. Come to visit the new museum Fingerprints of live .
